node.title: These slivers of carved mammoth tusk may be ancient jewellery — or something else entirely
node.description: A beautiful ivory artefact is the oldest example of decorated jewellery in Eurasia,  international archaeologists say. But could it be something even more intriguing?

node.title: Happiness is being able to afford a surprise vet bill
node.description: Money may not be able to buy happiness but recent research shows it helps. But the income needed for a happy life is increasingly out-of-reach for ordinary Australians.

node.title: Schools can still expel LGBTQ+ kids. The Religious Discrimination Bill only makes it worse
node.description: The Religious Discrimination Bill, in its third iteration, does nothing to protect LGBTQ+ students and teachers. It allows more, not less, discrimination by religious schools.

node.title: Live music to return in a 'major way' next year after summer shortage, peak body says
node.description: Australia is facing a shortage of live music this summer with concerts and festivals unlikely to return in "a major way" until the end of 2022, the industry's peak body says.

node.title: 'Tis the season for those tricky vaccine convos with your family. Here's how to go about it
node.description: Conversations about vaccination can be really hard, especially when you don't see eye to eye with someone you love. We asked the experts for tips on how to negotiate COVID over Christmas.

node.title: Solomon Islands Prime Minister blames foreign powers for civil unrest that prompted call to Australia for help
node.description: Protests in the capital Honiara quickly spiralled out of the control of local police, with arson and looting in the Chinatown district and the city centre, and crowds threatening to disrupt Parliament.

node.title: Countdown to Softball World Cup starts again
node.description: An upside to the delayed 2022 Men's Softball World Cup is that organisers expect the tournament to be far more competitive.

node.title: Survey shows extent of Covid-19 impact on south Westland
node.description: A new survey paints a grim picture of south Westland with more business closures, job losses, poorer mental health and community members leaving.

node.title: With ‘Encanto,’ Stephanie Beatriz Finds Yet Another Voice
node.description: The actress, also featured in “In the Heights” and on the series “Brooklyn Nine-Nine,” discusses her lead role as Mirabel in the latest Disney animated film.

node.title: Animal Shelter Overwhelmed After Rescuing 42 Cats From One Home: 'I Started to Cry'
node.description: The shelter rescued dozens of cats from a building that had been hit by a fire, and has already racked up thousands in costs.

node.title: Over One-Quarter of Texas Parents Say They Won't Vaccinate Their Child Against COVID: Poll
node.description: The survey comes after the CDC recommended earlier this month that children ages 5 to 11 should receive Pfizer's pediatric COVID-19 vaccine.

node.title: More psychiatrists considering leaving due to conditions - survey
node.description: A union representing senior medical doctors says almost half of its psychiatrists on the job are considering quitting as demand for their services soars.

node.title: Khichdi to the Rescue!
node.description: A gently seasoned pot of rice and lentils is the perfect antidote to holiday feasting.

node.title: Ethiopian Leader Vows to Lead Troops as War Threatens to Widen
node.description: Two years after receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed’s claim that he was going into battle reflected both resolve and vulnerability.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery's mom says guilty verdicts were "like a dream come true"
node.description: Three men were found guilty of murdering the 25-year-old while he was jogging in Georgia in 2020.

node.title: Stimulus Check Update: Millions Want More Payments as Inflation Impacts Thanksgiving
node.description: The American Farm Bureau Federation projected that the average cost of Thanksgiving dinner may have surged as much as 14 percent.

node.title: The Macy’s parade brings customers back for turkey hats and coffee.
node.description: Business was brisk for some as the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade returned to New York City. Delis, supermarkets, and even a man selling a turkey hat were overjoyed by the thousands of spectators.

node.title: North Korean Reportedly Sentenced to Death for Smuggling Copies of Netflix's 'Squid Game'
node.description: The alleged smuggler will reportedly face a firing squad, while high schoolers who were caught watching the show will reportedly face imprisonment.

node.title: Man Receives Hundreds of Responses After Inviting Complete Strangers to Thanksgiving Meal
node.description: North Carolina's Brian Davis will spend the holiday with a group of strangers who responded to his invitation on the Nextdoor app.

node.title: Covid-19 infections break records as Europe's fourth wave wreaks havoc
node.description: Coronavirus infections have once again broken records in nations across Europe, prompting new curbs on movement.

node.title: Rapid antigen tests available from pharmacies from next month
node.description: DIY Covid tests will be available in pharmacies from mid-December, while businesses will have access to them from next week.

node.title: National Party board did not endorse Bridges' demotion - president
node.description: The National Party's president has told members its board did not endorse demoting Simon Bridges, as claimed by Judith Collins.

node.title: At least 27 die in worst migrant disaster to date in English Channel
node.description: Five women and a little girl were among those killed when the inflatable dinghy, which they likely paid smugglers for space on, capsized in one of the world's busiest shipping channels.

node.title: States debate which occupations are worthy of hero pay
node.description: Minnesota lawmakers have $250 million in aid set aside for hero pay, but haven't decided how to distribute it.

node.title: Unemployed factory worker sues as Virginia tries to claw back benefits
node.description: "This is an agency that doesn't like the people that it's supposed to serve," Ernest Ray's attorney said.

node.title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
node.description: This Thanksgiving weekend, our critic recommends checking out a returning video-collage series, a goofy supernatural comedy and chocolatier competition.

node.title: Noah Gordon, 95, Dies; American Novelist With an Audience Overseas
node.description: His first book, “The Rabbi,” was a best seller in the U.S. Almost all his other novels were best sellers, too — but in Western Europe.

node.title: Scenes From 80 Years of Holiday Shopping in New York
node.description: Holiday shopping over the past 80 years as chronicled in photos from The New York Times archives.

node.title: Thanksgiving air travel rebounds, nearly hitting 2019 levels.
node.description: About 2.3 million people passed through security at airports on Wednesday, more than twice as many as in 2020.

node.title: Who is Allyn Walker? ODU Professor Quits After Pedophilia Remarks Spark Backlash
node.description: Virginia's Old Dominion University had placed Walker on administrative leave from their post earlier in November.
